note: The pottery from these phases has not yet been published but it has a clear transitional EB–MB character, and should belong, therefore, to Phase 6 as well.
title: The pottery of Phase 6 is the least well-illustrated of EB assemblages in the Euphrates Valley. The most complete published assemblage comes from level 6 at Tell Kabir (Porter 1995b: figs. 14–20). The latest EB occupation phase at Halawa Tell A, level 3a, almost certainly should belong to this phase
At Tell Amarna, Phases IV and III correspond to Phase 6
Last, recent excavations on the main tell at Tell es-Sweyhat have uncovered two settlement phases (5 and 6) that postdate the late third millennium city
